thread.title: ‘Strictly Come Dancing' Star Anthony Ogogo Questions The BBC's Decision To Pair Him With Oti Mabuse: ‘I Thought They'd Spread The Minorities Out'
thread.title_full: ‘Strictly Come Dancing' Star Anthony Ogogo Questions The BBC's Decision To Pair Him With Oti Mabuse: ‘I Thought They'd Spread The Minorities Out'

author: Rachel McGrath
title: ‘Strictly Come Dancing' Star Anthony Ogogo Questions The BBC's Decision To Pair Him With Oti Mabuse: ‘I Thought They'd Spread The Minorities Out'
text:
Previous Story Next Story ‘Strictly Come Dancing' Star Anthony Ogogo Questions The BBC's Decision To Pair Him With Oti Mabuse: ‘I Thought They'd Spread The Minorities Out' The Huffington Post UK | By Rachel McGrath reddit 
Anthony Ogogo has spoken out after making his ‘Strictly Come Dancing’ exit at the weekend, revealing that he was surprised to be paired with Oti Mabuse. 
The boxer explained that he didn’t think bosses would put him with black dancer Oti, telling The Sun: “I did not think that the BBC would put us together because we’re black or mixed race. I honestly thought they would spread the minorities around.” 
Anthony and Oti 
Anthony also added that it’s tough to do well in the competition if you don’t have any dance experience, as many of the stars’ showbiz pasts mean they’ve dabbled with strutting their stuff on the dancefloor. 
“It’s very, very hard for a novice to win the competition. I’m one of the few in the competition who’s got no dance history, I’m a complete novice.” 
Anthony found himself in the bottom two 
Once the judges gave their verdict, Anthony took the chance to thank Oti, telling presenter Tess Daly : “It's been brilliant. I want to thank Oti she has been amazing. MORE 'STRICTLY': Jay McGuiness Has Basically Won Already With This Routine 
“I feel sorry for her because she got lumbered with me, I can't dance and I've got a poorly little shoulder. She's done a wonderful job with me so thank you." 
While Anthony and Ainsley failed to impress viewers and the judges, things are hotting up at the top of the leaderboard, with Kellie Bright and Jay McGuinness impressing the judges, and resulting in The Wanted singer scoring the first 10 of the series . Close 'Strictly Come Dancing': The Most Memorable Awkward Moments of   From the second Russell stepped out of the giant shell, this was always going to be a disaster... Who can possibly forget the moment when Anton unceremoniously dragged Ann across the 'Strictly' dancefloor? A canon. A. Canon. Poor Chelsee was left in tears after a wardrobe malfunction forced her to take a short pause to readjust her outfit. Because it's not just the celebs who can be dragged around the room... Ann really was the gift that kept on giving, wasn't she? It's not just the dancers who can embarrass themselves, y'know! Mark and Karen were forced to restart their performance after their over-enthusiastic salsa moves somehow resulted in Mark's microphone becoming tangled in Karen's dress. Lisa and Brendan's freestyle displays the skill and finesse required to do well in the competition - but, the opening part where he picks her up is more than a little awkward, isn't it? Let's start with the mesh vest. Wow. Then there's the cringey shimmying too. Oh, Mark... The King and Queen of Cringey 'Strictly' moments unite for one of the most umm, memorable routines ever. After some intense spinning, Pamela staggers across the dancefloor and spending the rest of the routine trying to suppress the giggles.  Share
